title: Drawing, Elevation and plan of a doorway leading into a park, 1750–75
title_raw: Elevation and plan of a doorway leading into a park
medium: graphite, pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Above is the elevation. The doorframe is oblong; door opening has shape of semicircle. The entablature with a triglyph frieze projects laterally and is supported by an embedded column and pilaster on each side. The supports are Doric and consist of blocks and points. Above is an attic with a papal escutcheon in front of its central part with view of the park.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Elevation and plan of a doorway leading into a park, 1750–75. graphite, pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-510.
